cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code snippet accesses array elements fm->hdf[u] and fm->hd[u] using the u parameter as an index without performing any bounds checking. If the value of u exceeds the allocated size of the fm->hdf or fm->hd arrays, it will result in an out-of-bounds read, potentially leading to information disclosure, denial of service, or other undefined behavior.

cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes or the exposure of sensitive information.
explanation: The code uses the 'u' parameter as an index to access 'fm->hdf' and 'fm->hd' arrays without any bounds checking. If 'u' is greater than or equal to the size of these arrays, it will result in an out-of-bounds read, leading to undefined behavior such as a crash (denial of service) or potential information disclosure.
